controller

Class AnimationExportController

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.stage.Window
      • javafx.stage.Stage
        • controller.AnimationExportController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class AnimationExportController
extends javafx.stage.Stage
    A dialog for exporting a pattern sequence to an animated GIF. Generates a preview of the final GIF with user specified parameters for size, length and speed. Uses a GIFExporter object to create and save the animation to an output file. A private GameBoard object stores the board data and a BoardRenderer draws it to the canvas. The animation frames are simulated live with a supplied Simulator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimationExportController

        public AnimationExportController(GameBoard startBoard,
                                 Simulator simulator,
                                 int numberOfFrames,
                                 java.io.File outputFile)
        Loads the FXML document, sets up the stage and adds event listeners to GUI elements.
        Parameters:
        startBoard - The first generation in the animation.
        simulator - The simulator to be used when simulating the next generations.
        numberOfFrames - The suggested amount of frames the animation should have.
        outputFile - The file in which the data should be written to. If null, a FileChooser will be opened.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Sets up the boardRenderer, AnimationTimer and the pattern repetition hint.

      • locateLastIndexOfRepeatingPattern

        public static int locateLastIndexOfRepeatingPattern(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> hashCodes)
        Searches for a repeated sequence of generations. Compares all generations to the first one in the list, if it finds a match it checks for a matching sequence with the same length.
        Parameters:
        hashCodes - A list hash codes.
        Returns:
        The last index in the first occurrence of the repeating pattern.
